tidbits.title: Remote British Overseas Territory
tidbits.description: Pitcairn Islands are a remote British Overseas Territory known for their small population, pristine nature, and historical significance.

tidbits.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
tidbits.description: The islands gained fame due to the Mutiny on the Bounty, with descendants of the mutineers forming part of the island's population.

tidbits.title: Environmental Conservation
tidbits.description: Pitcairn Islands prioritize environmental conservation, with marine reserves and efforts to protect the unique flora and fauna.
